results.question: How much does Canva Pro cost monthly and yearly?
results.expectedAnswer: Canva Pro is about $12.99 per month, or $119.99 if billed yearly.
results.actualAnswer: Canva Pro costs $12.99 per month for monthly billing or $119.99 per year for yearly billing.

results.question: Are education accounts free?
results.expectedAnswer: Yes, teachers and students can apply for free Pro features through Canva for Education.
results.actualAnswer: Yes, education accounts are free. Teachers and students get Pro features but need to apply for them.

results.question: Can nonprofits get Canva Pro for free?
results.expectedAnswer: Yes, nonprofits can get Canva Pro free forever if they qualify by applying.
results.actualAnswer: Yes, nonprofits can get Canva Pro free forever if they qualify. They need to fill out a special nonprofit form, but sometimes get denied if they don't meet eligibility requirements.

results.question: How are Canva subscriptions billed by default?
results.expectedAnswer: Renewals are automatic unless canceled before the renewal date.
results.actualAnswer: Canva subscriptions have automatic renewals by default, so customers are automatically charged again unless they cancel before the renewal date.

results.question: Where can customers find their invoices or receipts?
results.expectedAnswer: Invoices are available in the "Billing & Plans" tab inside account settings.
results.actualAnswer: Customers can find their invoices in the "Billing & Plans" tab inside account settings where all invoices are downloadable. The button is sometimes hidden under the plan details.

results.question: What is Canva's refund policy?
results.expectedAnswer: Refunds are only possible within 14 days after the charge, and not for renewals after that window.
results.actualAnswer: Refunds are only possible if requested within 14 days after the charge and only if you didn't keep using the product. For Apple or Google Play subscriptions, refunds must go through Apple/Google, not Canva support.

results.question: Can Canva support cancel Apple or Google Play subscriptions directly?
results.expectedAnswer: No, customers must cancel through Apple ID or Google Play accounts themselves.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva support cannot cancel Apple or Google Play subscriptions directly. Customers must cancel through their Apple ID or Google Play account.

results.question: Does Canva offer family plans?
results.expectedAnswer: No, Canva only offers Free, Pro, Teams, Education, Nonprofit, and Enterprise plans.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva doesn't offer family plans. The available plans are Teams, Pro, and Enterprise.

results.question: What payment methods does Canva accept?
results.expectedAnswer: Credit card, PayPal, and in some regions local methods like iDEAL or Sofort.
results.actualAnswer: Canva accepts credit card, PayPal, and sometimes local methods like iDEAL or Sofort depending on your region. Crypto payments are not accepted.

results.question: Why do some customers think they were billed twice?
results.expectedAnswer: Usually because they accidentally created two accounts with different emails, each with Pro.
results.actualAnswer: Customers think they were billed twice because they accidentally created two accounts with different email addresses and both accounts have Pro subscriptions.

results.question: What is the difference between free and Pro templates in Canva?
results.expectedAnswer: Free templates are available to all users, while Pro-only templates are marked with a crown icon.
results.actualAnswer: Free templates are available to all users, while Pro templates are marked with a crown icon and require a Pro subscription. Pro users also get access to millions more stock photos, videos, and audio tracks compared to Free users' smaller library, plus AI features like background remover and Magic Resize.

results.question: Can Free users use the background remover tool?
results.expectedAnswer: No, the background remover is Pro-only.
results.actualAnswer: No, Free users cannot use the background remover tool. It's a Pro-only feature.

results.question: What is Canva's Magic Write tool?
results.expectedAnswer: Magic Write is Canva's AI writing assistant that helps draft text.
results.actualAnswer: Magic Write is Canva's AI writing assistant that can help draft text, similar to ChatGPT but integrated inside Canva.

results.question: How much storage do Free and Pro users get?
results.expectedAnswer: Free users get 5GB, while Pro users get 1TB of storage.
results.actualAnswer: Free users get 5GB of storage, and Pro users get 1TB.

results.question: Can users upload their own fonts in Canva?
results.expectedAnswer: Only Pro and Teams users can upload custom fonts through the Brand Kit.
results.actualAnswer: Yes, Pro users can upload their own fonts in Brand Kit. Free users cannot upload fonts. Uploaded fonts must be OTF, TTF, or WOFF format, and protected fonts cannot be uploaded.

results.question: Does Canva have a video editor?
results.expectedAnswer: Yes, Canva has a full video editor that allows trimming, transitions, overlays, stock footage, background music, and MP4 export.
results.actualAnswer: Yes, Canva has a full-featured video editor that allows cutting, trimming, adding transitions, text overlays, stock footage, background music, and MP4 export. You can also record yourself or screen record within Canva.

results.question: Can Canva users publish websites with custom domains?
results.expectedAnswer: Yes, but only Pro users can connect a custom domain. Free users can publish using a Canva link.
results.actualAnswer: Yes, Canva allows custom domain publishing for websites, but it's a Pro feature. Without connecting your own domain, websites use a Canva link instead.

results.question: Are there analytics tools in Canva that show how many people viewed a design?
results.expectedAnswer: No information.
results.actualAnswer: Transferring to human customer support.

results.question: Does Canva have built-in text-to-speech functionality?
results.expectedAnswer: No, Canva does not currently have built-in text-to-speech functionality.
results.actualAnswer: No, text-to-speech doesn't exist yet in Canva, but people frequently ask about it.

results.question: What is Canva Live?
results.expectedAnswer: Canva Live is a presentation feature where the audience can join with a code and react in real time.
results.actualAnswer: Canva Live is a presentation feature that allows audiences to join with a code and react with emojis and questions in real-time. It's commonly used in education.

results.question: What login options are available for Canva accounts?
results.expectedAnswer: Users can sign up with Google, Facebook, email, Apple ID, or Microsoft account.
results.actualAnswer: You can sign up and log in to Canva using Google, Facebook, email, Apple ID, or Microsoft account.

results.question: How are Canva designs saved?
results.expectedAnswer: Designs are autosaved in real-time, there is no manual save button.
results.actualAnswer: Designs are autosaved in real-time, so there's no save button. Work can be lost if you log into a different account or clear cache while offline.

results.question: What is the maximum upload size for files?
results.expectedAnswer: Images can be up to 100MB, and videos up to 500MB.
results.actualAnswer: The maximum upload size is 100MB per file for images and 500MB for videos.

results.question: Where can users find deleted designs?
results.expectedAnswer: Deleted designs go to "Projects" → "Trash," where they stay 30 days before being permanently deleted.
results.actualAnswer: Deleted designs can be found in the Trash, which is located under "Projects" → "Trash."

results.question: Can Canva be used offline?
results.expectedAnswer: Not really, only cached drafts can be opened without internet.
results.actualAnswer: Not really - only cached drafts can be opened offline. Canva doesn't have a desktop offline mode, just a web wrapper app.

results.question: How do you publish Canva designs directly to Instagram?
results.expectedAnswer: Publishing to Instagram requires a business account connected through Facebook. Personal accounts don't work.
results.actualAnswer: Click "Share" → "More" → pick Instagram. Note that Instagram personal accounts don't work, only business accounts via Facebook integration.

results.question: Can Canva websites support multi-page navigation?
results.expectedAnswer: No, Canva websites are single-page scrollers only.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva websites are one-page scrollers, not real multi-page websites. They work well for portfolios, resumes, and events but don't support true multi-page navigation.

results.question: Does Canva provide advanced SEO tools for websites?
results.expectedAnswer: No, only very basic options like title and description are available.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva only provides very basic SEO tools for websites - just title and description only.

results.question: Can Canva Docs include footnotes and advanced academic formatting?
results.expectedAnswer: No, there is no support for footnotes or advanced formatting.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva Docs does not include footnotes or advanced formatting, which is why academics often complain about this limitation.

results.question: Does Canva support creating interactive forms with text inputs?
results.expectedAnswer: No information.
results.actualAnswer: Transferring to human customer support.

results.question: What should customers do if Canva isn't loading at all?
results.expectedAnswer: Clear the cache or try a different browser (Chrome works best). If the issue persists, check Canva's status page.
results.actualAnswer: Clear your cache or try a different browser (Chrome works best). If nothing loads, check your internet connection or visit status.canva.com to see if there's downtime.

results.question: Why do designs sometimes disappear from a customer's account?
results.expectedAnswer: This usually happens because they logged into the wrong account (Google vs. email vs. Apple ID).
results.actualAnswer: Designs disappear 99% of the time because customers are logging into the wrong account (Google vs email vs Apple). Sometimes designs also disappear due to cache issues. Check all possible email accounts and try logging out and back in.

results.question: What happens if the transparent background option is missing?
results.expectedAnswer: The user is on the Free plan, since transparent background is Pro-only.
results.actualAnswer: If the transparent background option is missing, it means they're on the Free plan. Transparent background is a Pro-only feature.

results.question: Why might a payment be declined?
results.expectedAnswer: Common reasons are expired cards, insufficient funds, PayPal issues, or unsupported local methods.
results.actualAnswer: Payments might be declined due to expired card, insufficient funds, PayPal issues, or local payment method not supported. Try using another payment method.

results.question: What causes blurry images when exporting from Canva?
results.expectedAnswer: This happens when exporting in lower-quality formats. Customers should export as PDF Print or PNG for best results.
results.actualAnswer: Images look blurry after download when exporting as JPG. The solution is to export as PDF Print or PNG instead of JPG.

results.question: How many pages can a Canva design have before performance issues?
results.expectedAnswer: Designs can have up to 100 pages, but above 50 pages performance may lag.
results.actualAnswer: Canva designs start experiencing performance issues and lagging above 50 pages, though the technical maximum is 100 pages per design.

results.question: Does Canva support importing Photoshop (PSD) or Illustrator (AI) files?
results.expectedAnswer: No, Canva doesn't fully support PSD or AI imports. Only PDFs or SVGs (Pro-only) can be imported.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva doesn't support importing PSD or AI files fully. It only supports PDFs or SVGs (Pro only).

results.question: Can customers trademark a logo created in Canva?
results.expectedAnswer: No, because Canva elements are not exclusive.
results.actualAnswer: No, you cannot trademark a logo created in Canva because the elements aren't exclusive.

results.question: Does Canva provide a version history feature like Google Docs?
results.expectedAnswer: No, Canva doesn't support version history. Customers should duplicate designs to avoid losing work.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva doesn't have version history like Google Docs. If users overwrite something, it's gone unless they duplicate designs first.

results.question: Does Canva offer dark mode on desktop?
results.expectedAnswer: No, Canva does not offer dark mode on desktop. Dark mode is only available on the mobile app.
results.actualAnswer: No, Canva only has dark mode on the mobile app, not on desktop.
